output.conclusion: By completing this course, you will have a foundational understanding of estimation and costing principles, enabling you to contribute effectively to project planning and budgeting.
output.introduction: Welcome to Estimation and Costing for Beginners! This course provides a comprehensive introduction to the fundamental concepts and techniques used in project estimation and cost management. Designed for individuals with little to no prior experience, this course will equip you with the essential skills to understand and participate in the estimation and costing process.

chapters.description: Overview of estimation and costing. Importance in project management. Types of estimates. Cost classifications.
Direct costs vs. indirect costs. Fixed costs vs. variable costs. Opportunity cost. Sunk cost.
What is Analogous Estimating? Using historical data. Advantages and disadvantages. Examples.
What is Parametric Estimating? Using statistical relationships. Advantages and disadvantages. Examples.
What is Bottom-Up Estimating? Breaking down the project. Advantages and disadvantages. Examples.
What is Three-Point Estimating? PERT formula. Triangular distribution. Advantages and disadvantages.
Creating a cost baseline. Allocating costs. Contingency reserves. Management reserves.
Monitoring project costs. Variance analysis. Earned Value Management (EVM) basics.

chapters.chapterTitle: Software and Tools for Estimation and Costing
chapters.description: Overview of popular software. Spreadsheet software. Specialized estimation tools.
Tips for accurate estimation. Avoiding common mistakes. Importance of documentation.
